segment.source: Microsoft Enterprise Desktop Virtualization (MED-V) 2.0 enables the deployment and management of Windows Virtual PC images throughout an enterprise.
segment.target: Microsoft Enterprise Desktop Virtualization (MED-V) 2.0 enables the deployment and management of Windows Virtual PC images throughout an enterprise.

segment.source: By providing large-scale deployments of desktops running Windows XP Professional SP3 that are hosted through Windows Virtual PC, MED-V lets businesses upgrade to Windows 7, even though some of their applications might not yet be fully functional or supported.
segment.target: By providing large-scale deployments of desktops running Windows XP Professional SP3 that are hosted through Windows Virtual PC, MED-V lets businesses upgrade to Windows 7, even though some of their applications might not yet be fully functional or supported.

segment.source: This guide helps you understand, deploy, and manage your MED-V environment.
segment.target: This guide helps you understand, deploy, and manage your MED-V environment.

segment.source: By using the information provided in this guide, you can plan for and prepare your MED-V deployment, learn how to monitor and manage MED-V workspaces, and understand how to use MED-V to benefit your IT organization.
segment.target: By using the information provided in this guide, you can plan for and prepare your MED-V deployment, learn how to monitor and manage MED-V workspaces, and understand how to use MED-V to benefit your IT organization.

segment.source: Incompatibility of legacy applications together with new versions of Windows can often delay enterprise upgrades to the latest version of Windows.
segment.target: Incompatibility of legacy applications together with new versions of Windows can often delay enterprise upgrades to the latest version of Windows.

segment.source: Testing and migrating applications takes time, and users cannot take advantage of the new capabilities and enhancements offered by the newest operating system.
segment.target: Testing and migrating applications takes time, and users cannot take advantage of the new capabilities and enhancements offered by the newest operating system.

segment.source: By delivering applications in a Windows Virtual PC that is running Windows XP SP3, MED-V removes the barriers to operating system upgrades and lets administrators complete testing and address incompatible applications after the upgrade.
segment.target: By delivering applications in a Windows Virtual PC that is running Windows XP SP3, MED-V removes the barriers to operating system upgrades and lets administrators complete testing and address incompatible applications after the upgrade.

segment.source: From the user's perspective, these applications can be accessed from the standard desktop Start menu and appear side-by-side with native applications, so there is minimal change to the user experience.
segment.target: From the user's perspective, these applications can be accessed from the standard desktop Start menu and appear side-by-side with native applications, so there is minimal change to the user experience.

segment.source: Planning for Application Operating System Compatibility
segment.target: Planning for Application Operating System Compatibility
